bill_title: restrict the use of certain artificial lights to locate wild animals

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to restrict the use of certain artificial lights to locate wild animals . BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 41-8 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Notwithstanding the provisions of § 41-8-17, between the hours of 10 p.m. and 6 a.m., inclusive, from September first to December thirty-first, inclusive, no person may cast the rays of a spotlight, headlight, or other artificial light in any field, pasture, woodland, forest, or prairie to spot, locate, take, or attempt to take any wild animal except to take raccoons under the provisions of § 41-8-17. It is not a violation of this section for any person engaged in farming or ranching to use a spotlight, headlight, or other artificial light on property that he or she owns or leases to protect livestock or poultry from predator depredation. It is not a violation of this section for a person to carry out any agricultural, occupational, or recreational practice that is not related to spotting, locating, or taking a wild animal. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
